{{Infobox musical artist | name = Jon Lajoie | image = | alt = | caption = | image_size = | landscape = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Jonathan Lajoie | alias = Jon Lajoie, MC Vagina (alter ego) | birth_date = {{bda|1980|08|21}} | birth_place = | origin = [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]] | death_date = | death_place = | genre = [[Comedy music]], [[comedy hip hop]], [[comedy rock]] | occupation = [[Comedian]], [[musician]], [[actor]] | instrument = | years_active = | label = Normal Guy Productions | associated_acts = | website = [http://www.jonlajoie.com/ Official website] | notable_instruments = }}
'''Jonathan "Jon" Lajoie''' (born August 21, 1980) is a [[Canadians|Canadian]] [[comedian]], [[actor]], [[rapper]], [[singer]], [[musician]] and [[Internet celebrity]] from [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]].<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web|url=http://www.radio-canada.ca/radio/christiane/modele-document.asp?docnumero=57060&numero=1880 |title=Radio-Canada: â - Zone Radio |publisher=Radio-canada.ca |date= |accessdate=2010-01-09}}</ref>
== Background == Lajoie was born in [[Saint-Hubert, Quebec]] and raised in [[Montreal, Quebec]]. His father is [[French-Canadian]] and his mother is [[English Canadian|English-Canadian]]. He graduated from [[Dawson College]]'s theatre program in 2001.<ref>{{cite web|author=Lisa-Marie Glive |url=http://www.jonlajoie.com/aboutme.html |title=â The Official Website â About Me |publisher=Jonlajoie.com |date=2008-09-19 |accessdate=2010-01-09}}</ref> Since 2003, he has acted as an English-Canadian musician named Thomas Edison in [[Radio-Canada]]'s French-Canadian sitcom ''L'auberge du chien noir''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radio-canada.ca/emissions/l_auberge_du_chien_noir/2008-2009/personnages.asp |title=Personnages | L'auberge du chien noir | zone TÃ©lÃ©vision | Radio-Canada.ca (in French) |publisher=Radio-Canada.ca |date=2009-12-07 |accessdate=2010-01-09}}</ref>
==Career== Jon Lajoie began his career as a comedian in 2007. Lajoie's performance included music, skits, and some [[stand-up comedy]]. Jon Lajoie has also successfully released 2 studio albums. === ''The League'' === Lajoie currently has a role in the [[FX Network]] TV show called ''[[The League]]'' as Taco McArthur, a perpetually stoned and unemployed musician.<ref>{{cite web|last=Simpson |first=Peter |url=http://communities.canada.com/ottawacitizen/blogs/bigbeat/archive/2009/09/04/jon-lajoie-cancels-canadian-tour-for-big-tv-gig.aspx |title=Jon Lajoie cancels Canadian tour for big TV gig â The Big Beat |publisher=Communities.canada.com |date=2009-09-04 |accessdate=2010-01-09}}</ref> Lajoie performs his song "The Birthday Song" and "Vaginal Hubris" in two episodes of the first season. Throughout the series, Lajoie performs songs written specifically for the show.
=== ''Comedy Central Presents'' === Jon Lajoie filmed an episode of ''[[Comedy Central Presents]]'' on November 7, 2009.<ref>{{cite web|author=posted by: |url=http://ccinsider.comedycentral.com/2009/10/14/want-to-see-a-taping-of-comedy-central-presents/ |title=Want to See a Taping of Comedy Central Presents? | Comedy Central Insider Blog |publisher=Ccinsider.comedycentral.com |date= |accessdate=2010-01-09}}</ref> It premiered on March 5, 2010.<ref>{{cite web|author=posted by: |url=http://www.comedycentral.com/tv_schedule/index.jhtml?seriesId=11667|title=Comedy Central TV Show Schedule â Find when your Favorite Funny Shows are Playing | Comedy Central}}</ref> The same special aired uncensored as part of Comedy Central's Secret Stash on June 6 at 1:30 AM (EST). The special featured the world premiere of the video for his song "Pop Song".
